term.title: silver film

item.text: When viewed in reflected white light against a black background, transparent films show the classical interference colours of thin plates which permit an estimate of their thickness to be made. When of the order of 100 nm(1000 Å) in thickness they appear white (silver film) and when thinner they appear gradually less intensely white, then grey and finally black.
